thread.title_full: Giants' Odell Beckham Jr. has swelling in hamstring area, optimistic he'll play: source | NJ.com

author: Jordan Raanan | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Giants' Odell Beckham Jr. has swelling in hamstring area, optimistic he'll play: source
text:
Wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. has swelling in his hamstring area but still hopes to play on Monday night when the Giants face the Eagles in an important Monday Night Football contest, a person with knowledge of the situation told NJ Advance Media.
Beckham had an MRI on Monday that did not show any serious tears. He went about his normal business on Tuesday.
Coach Tom Coughlin said on a conference call with Philadelphia reporters that Beckham was day to day.
"The trainers seem to think he's made good progress. He wouldn't practice [Wednesday if there was one], no," Coughlin said. "Hopefully we'll get some work in before the end of the week. ... All we can do is hold out with the fact that he is a very competitive young man and if it's at all possible, he'll be ready to play."
The Giants players had Wednesday off.
These are all positive signs for a player that missed all of the preseason, most of training camp and the first four games of the regular season last year with a hamstring injury. The Offensive Rookie of the Year also missed time this spring with a hamstring problem.
The Giants are already without wide receiver Victor Cruz . They can't afford to be without Beckham.
Beckham injured his hamstring late in Sunday's 30-27 victory over the San Francisco 49ers. He missed most of the final two drives, although he did talk his way onto the field for part of the game-winning march and even drew a crucial pass interference penalty that set up the winning score.
